body:
Comment 4: 
I've not used gowin-env myself and this problem doesn't show up in the Go MinGW
environment, which uses some of Mateusz's batch files. He's cc'd with this reply. 

I tend to use forward slashes as path separators for everything on windows by default
and it seems to work, for me, 99.9% of the time. AFAIK, the MSYS shell interprets
forward slashes as path separators and backslashes as continuation characters. Root
drives for MSYS are nested between two forward slashes, so something like
GOROOT=/c/gowin-env is correct if you're in the MSYS shell.

-joe
